info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 14 at 12:15PM PDT until July 16 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Strong winds with low RH possible Saturday... .An upper level trough will approach the region Saturday into Sunday. This will bring increased winds Saturday afternoon, and possibly Sunday afternoon, that will combine with very low relative humidities resulting in possible critical fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WINDS WITH LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 285 AND 624... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * Impacts: Strong, gusty winds with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: In Northern CA...Fire Zone 285. This includes the communities of Alturas, Likely, and Tionesta. In South Central OR...southeastern Fire Weather Zone 624. This includes the communities of Lakeview and Valley Falls. * Wind: West 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Humidity: As low as 8 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD Precautionary/preparedness actions... If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Plan now to avoid using equipment that could cause sparks during the period when critical weather conditions are possible. Visit weather.gov/medford/wildfire for links to fire restrictions in your area. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning. &&
